The source and date of the photo were id: with evidence that it was published on Facebook on February 28, 2020, and shared more than 60 times.
The caption of the post was translated: revealing that it falsely claimed that Indian Prime Minister Modi ate excrement and referred to him as a "dajjal terrorist."
The original image was found through a G: showing that it was a doctored version of a photo of Modi eating a popular Indian dish during a festival in Delhi.
Additional evidence was provided: including screenshots of comments from Facebook users who were misled by the photo and the publication of the original photo on Modi's official Twitter page with a caption describing the dish he was eating.
